title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists warn of potential heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding in Boston from a Sunday-Monday nor'easter.
National Weather Service indicates the storm will impact southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island heavily with possible blizzard conditions.
Meteorologists highlight concerns about power outages due to heavy, wet snow and high winds, especially on Cape Cod and the Islands.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman joined the Chicago Cubs, leaving the Red Sox after not receiving a no-trade clause in Boston's offer.
Bregman declined to comment on Red Sox president Sam Kennedy's claim that Bregman chose to leave Boston.
Kennedy suggested Boston believed they made the highest offer, but Bregman confirmed multiple factors influenced his decision.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Apocalypse Now (Redux)" is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex, featuring the late Robert Duvall's memorable performance.
"Blue Moon" by Richard Linklater, with Ethan Hawke, is a 2025 biopic of lyricist Lorenz Hart streaming on Netflix.
"The Last Thing He Told Me" Season 2, starring Jennifer Garner, is adapting Laura Dave's sequel, streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora stated Marcelo Mayer must earn his Opening Day roster spot during spring training.
Mayer, 23, needs to improve offensively after batting .228 with a .674 OPS in 44 games last season.
Mayer missed part of last season due to a wrist injury but is fully healthy for 2026 spring training.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A nor'easter is expected to bring heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding to southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island late Sunday and Monday.
Meteorologists predict up to a foot of snow in the South Shore, Cape, and potentially metro Boston, starting Sunday night.
The storm is likely to cause power outages due to heavy, wet snow and high winds, with updates expected over the weekend.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court for the first time in person since allegedly killing her three children in 2023.
Clancy is facing three counts each of murder and strangulation and has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity.
Her lawyer filed a motion for a bifurcated trial to separate guilt determination from her mental state evaluation.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, potentially raising $60 million annually for housing.
The fee, ranging from 0.5% to 4%, only applies to the sale amount exceeding $1 million, with exemptions for specific buyers.
90% of the collected fees are returned to towns for local housing projects, with 10% funding a regional year-round housing trust.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police prepared for a 'Northshore Mall takeover' set for 3 p.m. Friday to ensure public safety.
The event involved vehicle takeovers with drag racing and car burnouts, similar to past incidents in nearby cities.
Governor Maura Healey allocated a $14 million safety grant to prevent such gatherings, which threaten public safety.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven alleged members of the Harvard Street Gang were charged in a federal drug and firearms investigation.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and over $40,000 in cash during coordinated searches in Eastern Massachusetts.
The investigation, ongoing since 2019, has linked the gang to drug trafficking, shootings, and other criminal activities.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics to join the Warriors, citing reasons beyond basketball for his decision.
The Celtics aimed to reduce salary, while Horford sought a fresh start, leading him to sign with Golden State.
Horford praised Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla, appreciating his leadership and the team's adaptability during injuries.
